news_header: WWF's Vice President of Conservation, Elina Kkilä, discusses challenges at the UN Conference on Natural Resources, particularly regarding financial agreements and support for global southern countries.
news_text: Elina Kkilä, WWF's Vice President of Conservation, highlights the difficulties in reaching financial agreements at the UN Conference on Natural Resources. The conference aims to promote nature conservation and funding to mitigate natural disasters. Kkilä notes that some global southern countries are seeking new funds from the West to address these issues. The meeting has faced delays, particularly concerning financial matters, and Kkilä mentions that schedule disruptions are common at large UN meetings. The conference is intended to evaluate and promote conservation plans and funding to meet objectives set in the 2022 UN Natural Resources Conference.
